faq.q: If I sacrifice the last warband from a site, can the attacker still take it?
faq.a: Yes. They’ve already targeted it.

faq.q: Can I take favor if the bank only has one left?
faq.a: Yes!

faq.q: Does the killed warband remove a second attack die?
faq.a: Nope, you’ve already collected dice. You lose one warband and one attack die, exactly.

faq.q: Does the killed warband count for $link:Cursed Cauldron$?
faq.a: Yes!

faq.q: Does this Supply gain stack on top of powers that let me spend no Supply?
faq.a: Yes! You’ll end up gaining Supply by campaigning in this case, not losing it.

faq.q: Does this power stack with $link:Mushrooms$?
faq.a: Yes. Guess he knows where all the good mushroom spots are.

faq.q: Does this count if I target a pawn at a site with an Order card?
faq.a: No, you have to target the site itself. Of course, if you target a site and other things, this power takes effect.

faq.q: Does “any Exile” include myself?
faq.a: If you’re an Exile, yes!

faq.q: How many exchanges can this prompt?
faq.a: As many as you want.

faq.q: Can I swap this with a locked card?
faq.a: Nope. A locked card cannot be discarded, moved or swapped.

faq.q: If I’m a Citizen and the Chancellor holds the Darkest Secret, do I get this bonus?
faq.a: Nope. “You” means you personally ($rule:10$).

faq.q: Why would I kill one of my own warbands?
faq.a: To refresh more Supply during your Rest Phase.

faq.q: If the defense pool has fewer than four dice when I use this power, but then the defender adds defense dice to their pool using their own battle plans, do I get +2 attack dice?
faq.a: No. You check this at the moment you use the power.

faq.q: If I am the Chancellor and have the Careless trait in the Imperial Reliquary, do I gain the extra favor if I trade for secrets?
faq.a: Yes!

faq.q: Does this let me draw two cards with Mushrooms?
faq.a: Yes. Guess you know where the good stuff is.

faq.q: When can I use this power when traveling to its site?
faq.a: If you rule the site.

faq.q: Can I kill one at a site and one at another site, or one at a site and one on a board?
faq.a: Yes, you can mix and match however you want.

faq.q: How does this interact with the Careless trait?
faq.a: You still don’t get the favor from Careless.

faq.q: How does this work with Imperial Allies if I’m the Chancellor?
faq.a: The “you” in this power, and all others, means you alone ($rule:10$). It does not count Imperial Allies.

faq.q: Wait, can I make a deal with an Exile if I’m a Citizen?
faq.a: Sure can.

faq.q: Does my attack roll include skulls?
faq.a: Yes. Basically, act as if you got all your dice results twice.

faq.q: Is the card discarded if I choose +/-1 attack die?
faq.a: No, only if you choose +/- 3.

faq.q: Does this increase the Visions Drawn track?
faq.a: Yes.

faq.q: Does the cost include any secret cost added by $link:Gleaming Armor$?
faq.a: Yes.

faq.q: Does this include the $link:Buried Giant$ and $link:The Hidden Place$ site powers?
faq.a: Yes.

faq.q: Does this include itself in the number of nomad cards ruled?
faq.a: Yes.

faq.q: What are the implications of relics being locked?
faq.a: They can’t be recovered or discarded or otherwise messed with. They’re stuck at the site, except for Ancient Bloodline’s ruler.

faq.q: Does this card mean I can have four advisers?
faq.a: Yup!

faq.q: Does this card stack with powers like $link:Augury$ and the $link:Greedy$ trait?
faq.a: Yes!

faq.q: Does this count things like the Oathkeeper bonus and defense dice added by battle plans?
faq.a: Nope, Giant Python specifies that it only counts defense dice added by declaring targets, which the Oathkeeper bonus and battle plans are not.

faq.q: Can I take someone’s last secret? Most cards don’t allow this.
faq.a: Yup! You’re giving them favor, after all.

faq.q: Can I use my other Trade modifier powers before using Master of Disguise?
faq.a: No, you fully replace your advisers with another player’s advisers for the current Trade action.

faq.q: Does taking burned favor include if someone recovers a relic from a site with a favor burn cost? What if I’m the one recovering it?
faq.a: Yup, you take the favor in all of those cases.

faq.q: When exactly do I pay for this power?
faq.a: When you choose to use it, immediately after someone takes relics and they’re in your region.

faq.q: If I’m the Chancellor and I’m joining a campaign as an Imperial Ally to a Citizen defender, does using this battle plan mean that the Citizen defender can’t use other battle plans?
faq.a: No. “You” refers to you alone, not your Imperial Allies ($rule:10$).

faq.q: If the bandits rule Code of Honor as well as other battle plans that they can use, which battle plans will they use when defending in a campaign?
faq.a: They will use Code of Honor and no others.

faq.q: Can I use Palanquin to go to a site with $link:Toll Roads$?
faq.a: Yes, but the player whose pawn is at your site must choose to give a favor to Toll Roads’ ruler, if they don’t rule it themself. If you rule Toll Roads, they must choose to give a favor to you—how generous, right?

faq.q: If we're both at the $link:Shrouded Wood$, who chooses where we go?
faq.a: You will always go to the site that you choose, as long as the other player could travel there. If you rule the Shrouded Wood, you choose their destination, which can be different from the site that you go to. If they rule the Shrouded Wood, they will travel to the same site as you. If a third party rules the Shrouded Wood, the third party will choose where the player travels.

faq.q: What happens if my enemy has multiple advisers of the same suit?
faq.a: Take one favor per adviser of that suit. So if they have two Hearth advisers, take two favor from the Hearth bank.

faq.q: If there are no warbands at the site I travel to, do I have to kill a warband on my board?
faq.a: Nope. It’s one at the site.

faq.q: Can I still travel to a site if there are no warbands there?
faq.a: Yup. That’s what the “if able” signifies ($rule:10$).

faq.q: Can I play a card facedown as long as I play the other to a site?
faq.a: Yes!

faq.q: Does the “unless your enemy has the People’s Favor” restriction apply to both the skull cancellation and attack dice?
faq.a: Yes, the entire power is canceled if your enemy has the People’s Favor.

faq.q: Does this include the $link:Conspiracy$?
faq.a: Yup!

faq.q: How does this interact with $link:Pied Piper$?
faq.a: Since Pied Piper ignores the adviser limit, you can have any number of Nomad advisers, Pied Piper, and one card other than Pied Piper.

faq.q: What if I don’t have any warbands?
faq.a: Not a problem. You only kill one if you have any on your board.

faq.q: How does this interact with $link:Hospital$?
faq.a: Warbands that would be killed are placed on Hospital’s site, as long as that player still rules it. Then, any warbands in that player’s force are put on Obsidian Cage.

faq.q: How does this interact with $link:Hospital$?
faq.a: Hospital prevents warbands from being killed, so you don’t gain warbands for them.

faq.q: Can I use this if my region’s discard pile is empty?
faq.a: Nope!

faq.q: So if I’m in $link:The Hidden Place$, can I force them to flip over a secret to travel to me?
faq.a: Yes!

faq.q: If they’re in another region and the $link:Narrow Pass$ is in my region, will Whistle work?
faq.a: Nope. They won’t be able to travel to you.

faq.q: What cases does this cover?
faq.a: All of them! You can campaign against sites but you can’t place warbands at them. You can’t drop off warbands using a minor action ($rule:6.5$). You can’t use $link:Warning Signals$ to move warbands around. And so on.

faq.q: Can the Chancellor use this?
faq.a: Yes! The other players should probably think about getting the Skeleton Key away from the Chancellor.

faq.q: How does this interact with the $link:Fertile Valley$?
faq.a: If you play a Hearth card to the Fertile Valley, you will get one secret (for playing to a site) and one favor (for playing to the Fertile Valley specifically).

faq.q: If I have the Bandit Crown, can I take the last warband off my site as a minor action ($rule:6.5$)? Likewise, can I simply put a warband on a site with no warbands on it?
faq.a: Yes to both! The bandit there counts as your warband, so you’re not really taking your last one off the site, and you rule empty sites.

faq.q: In the Chronicle, if I won, do I discard empty sites?
faq.a: Nope! You rule them.

faq.q: In the Chronicle, if I won as the Chancellor, and a Citizen has the Bandit Crown, do I discard empty sites?
faq.a: Yes.
